definition: (coll.) father's older brother/uncle/term of respect for older man
(coll.) father's older brother/uncle/term of respect for older man
my (you etc) old father/polite appellation for an elderly male
son of the boss/young master of the house/your son (honorific)
menfolk (collective term for men of different generations)/husbands and their fathers etc

sentences.english: Just then an old man came and helped me. A few minutes later, he mended the bike well.
sentences.chinese: 这时一个老迈爷走过来帮我，几分钟后车修好了。

sentences.english: Toya Fuji, a college student is dating a rising idol singer named Yuki Morikawa.
sentences.chinese: 爷富士，大学生和崛起的偶像歌手命名雪森川约会。

sentences.english: ”“She wants to, but Pa says he’s too dangerous.
sentences.chinese: “她想骑的，但是爷说骑那匹太危险了。

sentences.english: At the time that grandpa die, I was still young.
sentences.chinese: 爷去世的时候，我的年龄还小。

sentences.english: The Lurker is virtually the same as it was in the first game but has a more potent attack.
sentences.chinese: 这位爷和原版中基本相同，但是攻击更强了。

definition: I/me/my/(often used in early vernacular literature)

Buddha (term of respect for Sakyamuni 釋迦牟尼|释迦牟尼[Shi4 jia1 mou2 ni2])/His Holiness (refers to a Buddhist grandee)/Buddha/God/emperor/in late Qing court, refers exclusively to Empress Dowager Cixi 慈禧太后[Ci2 xi3 tai4 hou4]
son of the boss/young master of the house/your son (honorific)
uncle/father's younger brother/husband's younger brother/Taiwan pr. [shu2]
queen/empress/imperial concubine/Goddess, esp. Xi Wangmu 王母娘娘 or 西王母, Queen Mother of the West/mother/aunt
(dialect) form of address for one's wife/polite form of address for a woman
son of an official/son of nobility/your son (honorific)
adoptive father (traditional adoption, i.e. without legal ramifications)
my old mother/I, this old woman/my old lady (colloquial)/maternal grandmother/midwife
